alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 1:56PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Uintah and west central Daggett Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 155 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles southwest of Manila, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Uintah and west central Daggett Counties. This includes U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 365 and 387. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains
